text: Carmenta chromolaenae is a moth of the family Sesiidae. It is native to Venezuela, but was introduced to South Africa for the biological control of Siam weed (Chromolaena odorata). The length of the forewings is 4–7 mm.Carmenta chromolaenae Eichlin, a new species (Lepidoptera: Sesiidae) for the biological control of Chromolaena odorata (L.) King & Robinson (Asteraceae) The larvae feed on Chromolaena odorata. ==References== Category:Sesiidae Category:Moths of Africa Category:Moths described in 2009
title: Carmenta chromolaenae
